contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox film | name = Sarah and Son | image = Poster of the movie Sarah and Son.jpg | image_size = | caption = | director = [[Dorothy Arzner]] | producer = | writer = [[Zoë Akins]]<br />[[Timothy Shea]] (novel) | narrator = | starring = [[Ruth Chatterton]]<br />[[Fredric March]] | music = | cinematography = | editing = | distributor = | released = {{start date|1930||}} | runtime = 86 minutes | country = United States | language = English | budget = | preceded_by = | followed_by = }} '''''Sarah and Son''''' is a [[1930 in film|1930 film]] which tells the story of a woman who searches for the son that her abusive husband sold to a wealthy family. It stars [[Ruth Chatterton]], [[Fredric March]], [[Fuller Mellish Jr.]], [[Gilbert Emery]] and [[Doris Lloyd]]. The movie was adapted by [[Zoë Akins]] from the novel by [[Timothy Shea]].
